paragraphs.text: The single reason why I celebrate Christmas.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: The December issue of the Journal of Family Psychology contains no fewer than five research papers documenting religion's positive impact on family relationships
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Reading them reminds me of why I take my Christian faith seriously and the single reason I celebrate Christmas
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: What's
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: that reason?
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: It's not the wonderful lights, decorations, and music
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: all of which surely do help brighten our spirits and the short days of winter
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It's not watching kids' faces
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: when
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they lay eyes on Santa or receive the toys they wanted
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It's not even the seeming overall increase in generosity and loving-kindness in the public square at this time of year
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: All those aspects of Christmas are precious to me
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But the reason I celebrate the holiday is this: Jesus's ministry not only changed the world 2,000 years ago, it's transforming lives to this very day
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The essential Christian message of a loving, forgiving God is, at this very moment, healing broken people and families all over the world in ways that deserve to be called miraculous
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I could detail many true accounts of such glorious makeovers
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I'll settle for telling you just one
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It's the story of how I myself wouldn't exist if it weren't for the positive impact of Christianity on my family
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It begins with my maternal grandmother, Michaela Batallan (pronounced bah-tah- YAN)
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: who defined "liberated woman" long before the political movement of the Sixties
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We grandkids called her "Titi."
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Titi was born in 1896 into a well-to-do Catholic family in Ciego de Avila, Camaguey, Cuba
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: When
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: she was a young woman, she and her sisters emigrated to the United States all by themselves
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: They ended up living in Southern California
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: High-spirited, Titi liked to party and, one day at a dance, she met a tall, handsome ladies' man named Guadalupe Armendariz
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Born in Guadalajara, Mexico, he himself liked to drink and have fun
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: He didn't go to church
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: He didn't believe in God
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: When
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Titi was 28, she married Guadalupe
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: who by then owned a shoe repair shop in Saticoy, California
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: When they had children- starting with Betty (my mom), Carlos, and Yolanda - Titi gave up partying and began attending a Pentecostal church
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: It infuriated my grandfather
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: who demanded that she stop indulging in such religious mumbo-jumbo
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: She didn't obey
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: When
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Carlos was seven, he was stricken with polio and eventually couldn't walk
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: One day, out of desperation, Titi invited the minister and people from her church to come to the house and pray for healing
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: My grandfather was not happy
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: he wanted my grandmother to take Carlos to the Children's Hospital in Los Angeles for treatment
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: But that day, he witnessed something he couldn't believe nor explain
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: After the praying was done, Carlos immediately stood straight up and from that day onward was no longer paralyzed
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: My grandfather, seeing it happen with his own eyes, fell to his knees
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: He was never the same man again
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: My grandfather stopped drinking and partying and began attending church
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: In 1932, the entire family - my grandpa included- were baptized
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Not long afterwards, the family moved to Azusa, California
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: where my grandfather felt called to become a minister
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: With the help of his young sons - Titi and he ended up having eight children: four boys, four girls
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: - he built a church with his own hands
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: using materials he collected from around the neighborhood
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: It's still standing
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Years later, Grandpa Lupe's ministry was so successful his sermons were broadcast on the radio
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: By and by, he accepted an invitation from my paternal grandfather - Dr  Miguel Guillen, after whom I'm named- to join the Latin American Council of Christian Churches (LACCC)
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: of which Grandpa Guillen was president
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Later, Titi stepped up and founded a sister organization - the Pro-Seminario - to raise funds for the LACCC's fledgling seminary
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Just two weeks ago, in Galveston, Texas, I had the honor of preaching at the biennial convention of the LACCC
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: At ninety-one, it's the oldest, independent, Spanish-speaking Pentecostal organization in the country, with hundreds of churches in the United States, Mexico, and Central America
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I and the many others who attended the convention also had the joy of celebrating the 60th anniversary of LACCC's seminary
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: which Grandma Titi helped to build
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Clearly, I don't need the Journal of Family Psychology to tell me that religion has a significantly positive impact on family relationships
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But in a day and age when religion is being bashed on a regular basis by pop culture
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: finding validation of my family's life-changing experience in a well-respected scientific publication makes for a--- well, nice Christmas gift
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Yes, Jesus - Christianity - is able to dramatically improve lives
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And not always just our own
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: When
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Grandma Titi had the courage and conviction to stand up to Grandpa Lupe and embrace the faith
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: she ended up catalyzing a miraculous change not just in her own life, but in the life of her entire family ... of the LACCC's seminary ... of my own life
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Grandma Titi hadn't invited those Elders to lay hands on my uncle Carlos
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Grandpa Lupe hadn't become a minister
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the Armendariz family hadn't joined the LACCC and met the Guillen family
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Then my mother Betty wouldn't have met my father Mariano
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: ...and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I wouldn't be here to write this column
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Ultimately, yes, Jesus is the reason I'm here
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It's the reason I celebrate his birthday
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: the only reason Christmas means anything to me
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: For me and the two billion others on the planet
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: whose lives have been remade
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: it's a time when we celebrate the incarnation of love, light, and life - the hope of a better day, a better life, a better world
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Merry Christmas!
paragraphs.label: other
